result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim S.O. (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
**9-21-22 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM S.O.**

8:47 AM Defendant Jose R Lopez in court.  Attorney Robert William Keller in court for Jose R Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Atty was just obtained on this case.
Defense is requesting a status in 30-45 days.
Defense would like bond to be modified to lift the no contact order.
Victim is present and would request the same.
Victim has not gone to the WRC.
State has some concerns.
State has spoken with the victim and she wants the no contact order lifted.
State will leave matter up to the Court.
BTC: Will modify bond to allow no violent contact with the victim, the victim is ordered to consult with the WRC, Matter adjourned.
